activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Follow all conditions. 
Remain subject to terms and conditions of bond.

records.addlTxt:
3:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brad Jacob Harrison in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Brad Jacob Harrison. 
Plea questionnaire/DEJ filed. 
No contest plea  - Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists but will defer entry of judgment and accept the 12 month DEJ.
Bail continued- Current mailing address confirmed
Review hearing scheduled for August 21, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brad Jacob Harrison
Current: 218380 County Rd Hwy M, Stratford, WI 54484   (Effective: 04-07-2022)
Prior: 219380 County Road M, Stratford, WI 54484

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brad Jacob Harrison appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Brad Jacob Harrison. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 02:34 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
3:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brad Jacob Harrison in court. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant statement to counsel - states he is now qualified for PD - not appointed counsel yet. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court - states Defendant is qualified - will take case. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. 03:15 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brad Jacob Harrison in court. 
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel - Spoke with counsel but request additional time. Not eligible for PD.  
Bail continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brad Jacob Harrison appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on address. Defendant statement to address/bond/charges/has no drivers license/statement to transportation. Court sets bond. Case is a Branch II case. adj. 02:03 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
